info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 2 at 4:32PM EDT until May 2 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Cuyahoga County in northeast Ohio.
* WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Isolated rain showers and thunderstorms with periodic heavy rain are possible through this early evening and may worsen lingering flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cleveland, Parma, Euclid, Cleveland Heights, Solon, Warrensville Heights, Macedonia, Highland Hills, Garfield Heights, Shaker Heights, Maple Heights, South Euclid, Broadview Heights, Mayfield Heights, East Cleveland, Lyndhurst, Brecksville, University Heights, Bedford and Beachwood.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING
